website_summaries.verdict: Fragrance- and alcohol-free type of baby wipes that are safe to use on all ages of kids.
pros: Uses a plant-derived conditioner (aloe vera) that gives you the cleaning power you need, while remaining safe on the skin
Won't dry out the skin after use
cons: A bit more expensive than other wipes

customer_reviews.title: Daughter blistered after one day! Not the same as "original" wipes!
customer_reviews.text: Not the same great product as the original! I bought these, I thought, as an updated version of the original free and clear wipes. Turns out the ingredient list now contains several new ingredients including polyethylene and polypropylene. Within 1 day of using the new wipes my daughter broke out in a horrible blistered and painful diaper rash. I found one last pack of the old ones and the rash immediately started to get better, but you can't get the old formula anymore! Guess I'm switching to a new hypoallergenic brand. Super disappointed Seventh Generation.
customer_reviews.author: Oregonmom

customer_reviews.title: Pretends to be eco friendly but packaging isn’t even recyclable
customer_reviews.text: In the product photos, these wipe packets do not have the hard plastic flip top lid. However, when the product actually arrived they did have the lid instead of the peal back sticker closure. With the hard plastic lid, the wipe packets are NOT recyclable. I want to like this company but honestly I hate how they keep on pretending to be so eco friendly when so many of the things they do are the exact opposite. In the future, I’m not going to be wasting any more money with them but sticking to brands like Naty, Bamboo Nature, and etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn K

customer_reviews.title: ... major wipe brands and these are for sure my favorite. My little one has really sensitive skin and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all of the major wipe brands and these are for sure my favorite. My little one has really sensitive skin and gets diaper rash really easily. I was using a different brand for sensitive skin but realized they had alcohol which was burning her rash terribly. I bought these wipes and it was night and day, they didnt burn at all. The only downside is that these cost twice as much per wipe compared to the leading brands. The subscribe and save option was the best deal I could find but they keep going out of stock so it just wasn't reliable.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The wipes are fine..
customer_reviews.text: The wipes are fine...we like that they're free of most stuff that's bad for sensitive skin...but the lid is terrible. They don't stay closed so the next wipe or 2 is always dried out when you go to use them the next time. Even when you think you've got it closed up...it'll pop open as soon as you leave the room. Not a huge deal...but not a great thing either...
customer_reviews.author: notquiteajedi

customer_reviews.title: Causes the worst diaper rash!!
customer_reviews.text: Gives my baby the WORST diaper rash. I don't know how this is supposed to be for sensitive skin - regular pampers and buggies wipes don't even irritate her (but I feel more comfortable using natural wipes), but these wipes have her bright red and screaming in agony after only 2 days of use! We've tried several different times to make sure it wasn't something else creating it, but these wipes are the only variable that causes horrific diaper rash every time.
customer_reviews.author: jmc13

customer_reviews.title: They pill. Wishing I could return them after just the first sheet.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I like Wirecutter's advice and have bought dozens of items using them. But this "best wipes" rec. is...and I don't usually bother leaving reviews...simply horrid. I use wipes to get rid of lingering stickiness I feel from handling library books, shaking hands, etc. I cannot get past the pilling that you need to clean up after cleaning up. I have to brush my hands off over the garbage, that's how extensive the problem is. Wipes should take care of messes, not CREATE them. I never thought I'd promote Amazon's products, but we were happy with and will now go back to Amazon Elements Baby Wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Picky?

customer_reviews.title: Grat wipes, with they can fix a lil flaw in the dispensing
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are thick yet soft and not abrasive compared to other baby wipes. The formula is also very gentle and the scent is not too sharp, just clean smelling. I also like how there are not too many ingredients and my baby's fragrance-sensitive skin does not react to this at all. I just wish the plys don't stick to each other so much. I pull one and 5 tag along with it! A bit frustrating since these are not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: SamSaKi

customer_reviews.title: Immediately irritating to baby’s skin
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 1mo old with very sensitive skin because I heard great things... I used them for 1 afternoon and her butt is so red it could glow.... it’s awful - I was trying to change from the Pampers pure wipe that could be a little irritating on her bottom if you had to wipe too much but these were used delicately and still immediately left a rash - by second use I’m just dabbing them gently on her bottom and still the redness is awful!! Be careful buying these if your little one has very sensitive skin. I have already returned them... I’m so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Wipes are nice but wipes stick together, making diaper changing more difficult
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these.... the actual wipes are nice, soft and moist. But unfortunately the way they are packaged, each wipe does not come out separately. When you pull one wipe out, it sticks to the next one and you just get a long string of wipes. Normally this isn’t a problem... UNLESS you are trying to change a kick screaming baby, wrangling a poop covered diaper/baby with one hand and trying to quickly grab a wipe with the other. I wanted to like these but unfortunately it was a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: CChang

customer_reviews.title: I'm never going back to any other wipe
customer_reviews.text: I started out using Wal-Mart brand wipes because of the price, but when we realized how many we were going through because they're so dry, we had to switch. We then switched to the Huggies One and Done. They were thicker, softer and worked well. When I finally saw the price of these, I figured we would give them a shot, and I can honestly say that we will never be going back to any other wipe. They are not scented, so they don't smell good, or bad, they leave no irritation and they're the wettest diaper wipe I have ever used. I need so many less wipes than any other wipe I've used. I'm so glad we tried these!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Thick, moist, no particular smell
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a baby but I routinely use wet wipes to spot-clean surfaces at home, as well as my own skin sometimes. I like this brand because they are thick enough so they don't tear or shed small pieces while you rub them against some surface. They are saturated with liquid but not perfumed, and I like this. I have sensitive skin prone to eczema, but there wasn't any irritation when I used these wipes on myself.
customer_reviews.author: Disasterrr

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality. Saving us money in long run
customer_reviews.text: We are bargain shoppers. I tend to buy the cheapest wipes (Target's house brand) It always seemed we were flying through bulk boxes of the "bargain" wipes. And the last bit of wipes would tend to dry out. My husband bought a 3 pack of these wipes from the store. They lasted us FOREVER! So we are sticking with these. They don't tend to dry out, and the wipes are nice and thick, so we find ourselves not needing as many. Great wipes!
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Thinking these are fake ones
customer_reviews.text: First off I want to say I love seventh generation wipes. I have a sensitive little guy and these work great. I have been buying these off and on for 3 years from amazon. I recently just purchased these and still had one pack of wipes left from target. They are completely different. The ones I got on amazon smell like baby shampoo and the ones from target have no smell and the ones from amazon are also a different size. I am assuming these are fake ones. So disappointed. Will never buy these off of amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Mimomofboys

customer_reviews.title: My fav
customer_reviews.text: Ok so these are my absolute favorite wipes because of how clean the ingredients are and I can safely use them all over my baby with out any worries, my little one has extremely sensitive skin and these did not irritate him at all even when used around his mouth. I will say that they are not the softest but they are nice and thick I never have to worry about them tearing. I feel like I get the job done with less wipes when using these then with other brands wipes. They are a bit expensive but I can appreciate why and will repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actually awesome
customer_reviews.text: Starting off by saying these are pretty great! So not my normal brand but we got these cus we couldn’t find any in store. And was prepared to start making my own if needed. We got these. I would say they are thick And textured like huggies. Soft and smooth like pampers/up&up.
customer_reviews.author: rageone

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: We struggled to find the "perfect baby wipe" which took into consideration both ingredients and price. After much research we landed on 7th Generation. While they are not as "clean" as water wipes, they are a happy medium between limited ingredients and not being crazy expensive.
customer_reviews.author: SnazzyTopazzy

customer_reviews.title: I really like the fliptop
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest price that I can find for these currently. I really like the fliptop. I used to get the non-flip top but found that folks in the house left the package open more often than not and the top one or two wipes would dry out and be unusable without wetting them. Wetting them again is the last thing you want to be doing when you are trying change a wiggly baby. So, for a little more, it is worth getting the flip-tops in our case to prevent this inconvenience. Also, it says the bags leaking while traveling. The others seem to leak more than these flip-tops. They don't seem to leak in our case anyway.
customer_reviews.author: GAMS Mommy

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: Within 24 hours of using these my babys bum and privates broke out in a horrible rash and blisters. My baby's skin isn't sensitive either so something is in these wipes is more harsh than their packaging claims.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst wet wipes I’ve ever used. Gave my baby the worst diaper rash he’s ever had. Took me several days to figure out it was these “natural wipes”. He was so sore and was bleeding!!!! It was terrible. Do not waste your money. I didn’t open the box right away because I didn’t need them yet- so when I did I was outside the 30 day window to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Emyipt

customer_reviews.title: NOT for Sensitive Skin! NOT TOXIC FREE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this under the impression they were for sensitive skin and free of the junk like advertised. After 1 day of use my daughter developed a horrible rash. Very disappointing! Since she was born I’ve always used Water Wipes and Honest Wipes with zero issues and zero rashes. When I looked at the ingredients list (should have done before buying) you can see where they sneak in some bad ingredients. Hate I wasted the money on this huge pack. I immediately ordered water wipes after her rash started and now we are back to rash free clear skin. If you are looking for non toxic sensitive wipes, these aren’t it! I’ll be sticking to the honestly advertised water wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Foil

customer_reviews.title: Strong and gentle
customer_reviews.text: These baby wipes are sturdy and not too wet. Now that my 10 month old is eating we use them not just on her bottom but to clean her face and hands after she eats. They hold up well to wiping and don’t leave too much water or lint behind. She was getting diaper rash from her other wipes leaving too much moisture behind so these ones are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Not a single complaint!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these everyday for the past four months on my little one and I've had no issues at all! I haven't needed to use any other wipes to compare these to, and am grateful for that! I particularly love that they're made for sensitive skin, and that Seventh Generation doesn't test on animals. I feel good about buying these, and good about using them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Disposable Diapers
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter ended up being so allergic to the chemicals in regular diapers we had to use burn cream on her. These diapers have worked so well and feel great. We tried Honest Diapers and they always felt hard, these don’t. I’m never going back to other diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay, can be better
customer_reviews.text: So the pros, it is very durable. The material is made of thick stuff. The container has a plastic tab on it so you don’t need to put in in a container. It is fragrance free. The cons, you don’t just pull one, you can’t pull it out one handed without getting a lot of extras you don’t need. It’s also not very wet.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Wipes are quite thick.
customer_reviews.text: My expectations for these wipes were high until I tried them. And then I tried the Costco wipes after. I like the Costco ones better because the wipes are thinner and easier to maneuver in your hand to wipe and gather the poop from your bebe’s bottom. Seventh Generation wipes are quite thick and I don’t feel like I am being the most economical when using them because it’s difficult to maneuver when wiping.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent eco-friendly & gentle wipes
customer_reviews.text: We have used these wipes for our daughter for over two years, and they're one of our most essential baby products. They don't irritate her skin like most typical wipes, and the lack of cloying 'baby powder' smell is much more pleasant for everyone. The wipes are strong and effective at cleaning, and these pop top packages keep the wipes ready to go for weeks (which is as long as they ever last around here!) overall, these are just an excellent product which should serve parents well. We were also pleased to receive a free sample from seventh generation of a travel sized pack. Our opinions are our own.
customer_reviews.author: S.K. Weed

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom line is that they are not flushable. It is stated in the small print on the package. So, look for brands that are flushable unless you want to help put your plumber's kids through college.
customer_reviews.author: Martin JM

customer_reviews.title: Bag sucks and tears
customer_reviews.text: Not a problem with the wipe itself but every package in this box the opening flap has torn or fell off every package. Normally after the first or second opening. Will not be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing wipes for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are amazing! They are the only wipes I can use on my son. He has severely sensitive skin and all other wipes give him an awful rash. They are so thick and soft and they are fantastic! I love these wipes they are a great price for how many you get.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Heather

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes ever
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wipes. Definitely worth the extra money! My daughter has sensitive skin and these have worked the best for her. They are nice and thick so you feel protected when cleaning dirty diapers
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P.

customer_reviews.title: Soft, gentle, and chemical free
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes. I buy them for my daughter in another state. She has two in diapers and uses a lot of wipes. These wipes are a larger size and you do three wipes per wipe without any bleed through. Because there are no perfumes, dyes, alcohol, or lotions it is very gentle on a baby's skin. Also, because it is so organic you can use them to clean messy hands and faces!
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Sagel

customer_reviews.title: A little too moist
customer_reviews.text: You have to either pat dry the baby’s “area” or wait a minute before putting diaper on (impossible with a boy) because these are extremely moist. Other than that they’re great
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like that these wipes are chemical free and safe for babe. They stay moist down to the last wipe which is a big plus for me. They do seem to leave little particles behind, which I don't love but doesn't bother me enough to stop using. I used to use Honest wipes and I really do like Seventh Generation better, the Honest wipes did not seem as moist and therefore weren't as easy to use. The price is great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Cadatal

customer_reviews.title: Wipes came in dry. Maybe a bad batch?! Do yourself a favor - get Water Wipes
customer_reviews.text: Gave this 2 stars because my wipes were dry and didn't get the job done - a.k.a clean my little one's bottom. I have tried using Pampers wipes and they were better, but at times my little one developed a butt rash (redness on butt). Finally, I opted to get the best, Water Wipes, like butter to a baby's bottom (kidding, it's 99% water based and it's soft and more expensive but you have to get the best cleaning wipes for your babies.)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: ONLY WIPES UNDER THIS ROOF
customer_reviews.text: 3 heartbeats - 8yr - 4mon & introduced meself to these, back when our 2nd joined the family in 2014 ... I've tried EVERY WIPE on the market (yes even over seas & making mine own) & SEVENTH GENERATION wipes are my ONLY go to - THICK DURABLE & INDIVIDUALLY FOLDED (no perforated edge) - I refuse to use any other wipes Target is where I first found these ... back in 9/14 a 256ct pack was 9.99 ... it's now 14$ (15$ with tax) ... Amazon is practically giving these away !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy for baby wipes but good for cleaning wipes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these so that I may turn them into Clorox or Lysol wipes they're good for that purpose however they're definitely not worth the price if you're using for baby not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers for our Baby
customer_reviews.text: Our son reacts best to these diapers compare to Huggies or Pampers or other brands we've used abroad when traveling. Rarely has a skin reaction or redness on his bum when wearing these, vs I can always tell when we've run out and had to use a different brand. His skin is always more irritated. We love Seventh Generation. They are super absorbent too!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre Hourquebie

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes but sheets easily stick to each other
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give these a 5 are that the sheets stick easily to each other and it's easy to pull out several at the time. Some of the boxes have also had faulty closing mechanisms so that the top wipe dries out easily. But they softness, scent and sensitivity is great and our baby has never had a reaction to the wipes (which I think is the most impt)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOOK NO FURTHER FOR WIPES-THESE ARE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was using Nutragena Facial Wipes. This are larger and 1/4 the price. Very nice product. About 4 cents each versus 15 cents for Nutragena Facial Wipes. Its possible Nutragena includes some moisturizer in theirs but for the cost, this is a much wiser buy. These are really versatile for many uses. Thank you Seventh Generation for such a fine product. We are blessed here in America.
customer_reviews.author: shoshanna

customer_reviews.title: great wipes
customer_reviews.text: Good quality baby wipes. Thick, sturdy, unscented, well moist, and gentle on the skin. Packaging is good for at home or on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fav Wipes
customer_reviews.text: My #1 pick for wipes. I use them to remove make up at night among other things. Even for wiping down toilets- The company has improved the product, it is thicker, more moist & the open/close of the package is now excellent.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Gentle and unscented
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these. I go through them like crazy. They're great for a quick wipe-down after exercise or at the end of the day. Any time you need a quick touch-up but a shower's not in the cards. They're very neutral scented and gentle, and I would definitely use them on my infant/child if I had one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfaction 100%
customer_reviews.text: Been using water wipes but the prices went up so high so decided to try 7th generation. Total dissatisfaction - the TISSUE tears off! into small powder just like when you wet your toilet tissue. Requested refund just before.
customer_reviews.author: Seungbong C.

customer_reviews.title: great for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I am sensitive & have lots of allergies. These work great, get me clean without bothering my allergies or burning or irritating my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G

customer_reviews.title: Very moist
customer_reviews.text: I use these for two purposes. Wiping makeup off my face and cleaning stamps in my art studio. Excellent for both uses!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Good for humans and cats.
customer_reviews.text: Super excellent, just slightly acidic quality to feel clean & fresh. I always get this brand. I also use it to rub under my kittie's chin where accretions accumulate. She likes the fell. Veterinarian says that an alcohol wipe, or something similarly acidic helps keep the pores dry and open.
customer_reviews.author: unsworthyeti

customer_reviews.title: Great, somewhat eco-friendly disposable
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers! They always last through the night. I do wish the attachment tabs didn't have 3 parts to fold out, it takes extra time when I'm wrestling a toddler. But, no biggie!
customer_reviews.author: Krista W.

customer_reviews.title: Relieve for your most sensitive parts.
customer_reviews.text: If you have sensitive butt this product is for you. I’ve been using this product for over 13 years. My two boys are still using it from birth. Doesn’t get any better.
customer_reviews.author: Masha Godzhik

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I loathe these. Smears everything (read: poop) all over. No texture to pick up. Smells scented. Big fail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes
customer_reviews.text: These have been my favorite wipes for 2 babies now. Just the right amount of wetness to get the job done, they don't dry out (even if left in extreme temperatures). Never a rash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes! They are thick and very gentle on my baby’s skin. These are by far my favorite wipes.
customer_reviews.author: ODW

customer_reviews.title: Great baby wipes.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using seventh generation baby wipes for the last 2 years with our 2 year old son, we have also been using them with our 2 month old daughter. These do not have an obnoxious smell like some of the other baby wipe brands do, I haven't had any issues with seventh generation baby wipes causing irritation on my kid's bottoms. I also use these when camping to keep clean -- and they work great for that too.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Good for baby bottoms
customer_reviews.text: My son has really sensitive skin. These work so well for us. I’m going to stick with them!
customer_reviews.author: Auditty

customer_reviews.title: Not so soft
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for these because, I love their other products. They are not soft at all though. Rubbed one on my face and it's scratchy. I think they are made of wood pulp and a type of plastic (wft?). Gave my infant diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: P3pp3R

customer_reviews.title: Not buying then again
customer_reviews.text: They don’t offer enough moisture. I don’t feel like my baby is completely clean after using them. Wouldn’t recommend, honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Way too thick, amazon brand is better
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are way too thick. They don’t clean nearly as well as their thinner counterparts. They’re natural and organic, but you have to scrub your baby’s but harder than you would with regular wipes. Do yourself a favor and just buy the amazon band wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney G.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby wipes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are by far my favorite. They are nice and thick, but not too thick, and make for easy clean up in a messy diaper. They are also gentle on my son's sensitive skin. The price on the box is very reasonable compared to buying them at Target one pack at a time. I will continue buying these for sure. I also use them for wiping his face and hands after eating.
customer_reviews.author: PeakS

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes!
customer_reviews.text: Best. Wipes. Ever!!! These are all I use on my baby's bottom. They are thick enough I only have to use one wipe (usually) and they are free of all the other junk you find in many brands of wipes. My baby has never had diaper rash except for one time when I tried to use a sensitive type of wipe from another brand. I love these and they are a staple on my subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: I thought I was going to love this wipes but I’m not much of a fan
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love this wipes but I’m not much of a fan, I bought a whole box n I’m still using them, but trying other wipes I do love the water wipes, I hate the container on this the plastic openings break of very easily, they r glued to the bag and come of every time
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: A brotherly gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my 2 baby nephews in Louisiana. They love them!
customer_reviews.author: Boopsey43

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. It’s plastic and causes rashes. This brand is a horrible brand, I didn’t like their diapers either.
customer_reviews.author: sheereen sh

customer_reviews.title: Good price, quantity and natural
customer_reviews.text: Good price and a lot. I got these because of trying to get more natural products and not too expensive either
customer_reviews.author: abf2224

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fall apart in the middle of using!
customer_reviews.text: Not as soft as I thought they would be. Not awful either though. Great otherwise. Very sturdy and don’t fall apart while using which is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: NerdyMom850

customer_reviews.title: I love the seventh generation products
customer_reviews.text: I love the seventh generation products, and I especially love these baby wipes. They are great for my sons sensitive skin. They are also thick enough to clean and do not fall apart very easily. So far these are the only baby wipes that are gentle enough on his skin and clean areas without leaving any scent or chemical. I would highly recommend these wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeebean143

customer_reviews.title: YESSSSSSSSS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best wipes ever!! Even works great for removing makeup!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I like these wipes because they are thick and sturdy. They don't smell much at all and they dispense easily. I have been using these for two months now and will not switch. These are much better than the average brand (Pampers, Huggies). These are also a good value compared to other natural wipes on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Actually works for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I use these myself to freshen up. I have extremely sensitive skin and these don’t cause me any problems. They really are unscented.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite wipes! I use this for everything when it comes to my grandson. I am obsessed with seventh generation!
customer_reviews.author: Shaller

customer_reviews.title: Great quality wipes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes stay nice and moist and clean up nicely
customer_reviews.author: Bek

customer_reviews.title: No sting wipes, even for the most sensitive bums
customer_reviews.text: Easily our favorite box of wipes. Sometime my little one's ouchy bum makes her scream. Before I knew better we used other "sensitive" wipes which made the stinging worse. Now I assure her, "these aren't the ouchy kind" and she settles right down. These are easily the only wipes we buy. Before ordering them on Amazon I went out of my way to pick them up. As in, I drove 25 miles each way for a special Target trip.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Perry

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes.
customer_reviews.text: No other wipes can compare. These clean all the mess off at diaper changes!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: Essential baby product that’s safe, natural
customer_reviews.text: The baby wipes come in convenient travel size packages that allow you to easily carry them with when you travel or just around the house. The wipes are scentless and are made from natural plant-based ingredients. My wife and I use them for hanging diapers and cleaning hands and face after my son is done eating. They are an absolute essential for parents.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: No name on Cover.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t have the name Seventh Generation on the top of the plastic cap, like the original. But the wipes were the same as original.
customer_reviews.author: John Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They do a great job cleaning and don't irritate my sensitive skin. I do notice they tear easily but haven't noticed the lint other people do.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of different wipes and these are the best. Thick and sturdy, with just the right amount of moisture. I feel like I use less of them than the Babyganics wipes, which is what I was using prior to these.
customer_reviews.author: Allison A Phears

customer_reviews.title: I love these and I only use this brand of wipes
customer_reviews.text: I love these and I only use this brand of wipes. I CANNOT STAND how other wipes are so thin and fold up as you're wiping. These do not do that and I am able to use less each time due to that. I also love the flip top and keep a pack in my diaper bag instead of using those plastic wipe containers.
customer_reviews.author: JoshnEmily

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: These arrived well before the expected delivery date, which makes me extra happy :)! The product itself is fantastic and one of the best on my very sensitive little girl. These are worth the money and I appreciate the competitive price in comparison to big box redial store... With the convenience of home delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic1

customer_reviews.title: Not to dry not to wet just right
customer_reviews.text: Only wipes I will use coming from huggies and Pampers
customer_reviews.author: C love

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping! Great price what more could I ask for? Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Santana

customer_reviews.title: The flip top is a nice improvement over the old stick on
customer_reviews.text: We prefer these over all the other brands. The flip top is a nice improvement over the old stick on, peel off top. They are medium thickness and moisture is good. They do a good job of getting things cleaned up. They have never caused any skin irritation and the scent is very mild.
customer_reviews.author: maddy ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Love these wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mama of three with one on the way and I love these wipes, they are the only brand i use. They are great for sensitive skin and don't have a strong fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.text: Great wipes, especially for sensitive skin, and I love that there is no fragrance
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Oh no, I need more Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: They are super fun, and great for messy diapers. Did I see the messy was super fun, oh no. Dirty diapers more white bees, Alexa order more wifey’s. Hey Siri order my wife is.,
customer_reviews.author: Phillips Creates

customer_reviews.title: Love these for wiping off food/milk etc
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job cleaning up my 6 month old after meals, spit up, etc. We use other wipes for diaper changes, but these for everything else. Have even wiped his eye lids with them & there's no irritation.
customer_reviews.author: NebraskaMamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes. They're so sturdy and I love that they're not scented.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Dry
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try a new product , thought these were supposed to be good, they are actually really dry compared to pampers sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie ruthe

customer_reviews.title: I like these wipes for the natural aspect
customer_reviews.text: I like these wipes for the natural aspect, but they make my little ones bum raw and rash. I sadly can't return the 3 remaining boxes I had stocked up on. Babyganics has been a better product by far.
customer_reviews.author: emily wilde

customer_reviews.title: work well
customer_reviews.text: I use them for my own behind, and they work well and are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes!
customer_reviews.text: Love these wipes! Gentle on baby's skin, soft, and perfect amount of moist. They are much cheaper than honest wipes and I like them a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Glad they went back to the plastic flip top lids
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easier to close and maintain the moisture with the hard plastic flip top lid than just the re-sealable flap of the thin plastic bag.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Must have wipes.
customer_reviews.text: Love these wipes. They don’t have all types of chemicals in them. The ingredients used are safe enough for my baby’s skin. I’ve always used these and my son has never had any skin irritation from them. They’re great for cleaning his baby hands and face.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This product is awesome
customer_reviews.text: These baby wipes are awesome. My son has extremely sensitive skin. I switched to this brand and babyganics and my son has not had a rash sense. I rate this product four stars because of the price. Babyganics provides the same quality and protection but has more wipes
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Girl

customer_reviews.title: The only wipes I buy
customer_reviews.text: Best wipes on the market. My son has very sensitive skin. These wipes are super soft. I've never had to add extra water to remoisten them. They clean up messes with fewer swipes and less scrubbing than I've had to apply with other wipes. That makes it cost effective for me, because I don't have to use as many.
customer_reviews.author: A. Klos

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite wipes. I don't have to use and many as I do with leading brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine product, but I still prefer Huggies sensitive over all others that I have tried
customer_reviews.author: Allison M

customer_reviews.title: The best baby wipes in my opinion! Super moist...
customer_reviews.text: Super duper moist wipes! I love these. All natural, she hasn't had a diaper rash since I changed her over to these over 8 months ago! I was using pampers sensitive and normal pampers wipes, they don't compare to these. I only order them from Amazon because it is such a good deal compared to the store prices. I highly recommend you get the flip top lid one so they stay nice and moist when not in use!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Starr

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I like this wipes, they don't smell the greatest but they work for my daughter she is very sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Maysa

customer_reviews.title: these baby wipes are moist and thick. even if ...
customer_reviews.text: these baby wipes are moist and thick. even if you forgot to put the flip lid back for a day, the first wipe will be still moist. they are able to get the heavy duties done also the lids are really hand. But they leave lint on my LO's skin. We've tried another 7th generation baby wipes that do not come with flip lids, they are thinner, but also moist and they do not leave lint. i switch to that and will not purchase these baby wipes with flip lids again.
customer_reviews.author: TeLin C.

customer_reviews.title: They're okay
customer_reviews.text: They're okay. I appreciate the environmental benefits, but they're kind of stiff and difficult to work with... but at least they don't ball up like the really flaccid kinds.
customer_reviews.author: chewbecca

customer_reviews.title: Great for face!
customer_reviews.text: We love these for cleaning up baby after a feeding. They are nice and soft and clean well. We don't use them on bottoms so I can say how they work there.
customer_reviews.author: Wilcox

product_meta.title: Seventh Generation Baby Wipes, Free & Clear Unscented and Sensitive, Gentle as Water, with Flip Top Dispenser, 384 count (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Seventh Generation Free and Clear baby wipes are thick, strong and made for sensitive skin designed to be gentle, these generously sized wipes are built with the cleaning power you need and the care your baby deserves You’ll get all the comfort and performance of cloth while using fewer wipes Try using just one less wipe per change and watch the savings grow Serious cleaning is needed for more than just sensitive bottoms Our baby wipes are moistened with aloe vera, vitamin E and water to cleanse and moisturize gently and naturally These Free and Clear wipes more than just unscented and dye free These baby wipes are non sensitizing, hypoallergenic and safe to use on baby’s hands and face Your baby doesn't get to choose what goes on their sensitive skin, but you do.
feature_bullets: Made for your baby’s sensitive skin
Thick and soft wipe for a gentle clean that is safe for baby, hands, and fACe
Easy dispensing flip top lid keeps wipes moist and fresh, contains 384 wipes
Pack of 6, 384 total baby wipes with convenient flip top snap tight opening on each package
Seventh Generation Baby Wipes are safe for Baby, hands and face
Fragrance free and 0 percent alcohol, parabens and phenoxyethanol
Strong and thick baby wipes make it easier to clean up all of Baby’s messes
